p: As it is a new strain, there is little information about SARS-CoV-2 in pregnant women. In addition, infections by MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV in this profile of patients are regionally limited. Thus, external factors such as local habits may contribute to the general picture. The few published obstetric cases point to the need for advanced life support for these pregnant women and for a severely compromised maternal and gestational prognosis [ [82], [83], [84]].
